items.sentence: Tom made me promise not to tell Mary anything.
Tom doesn't like being told when to go to bed.
Tom doesn't like being told to clean his room.
To tell the truth, I never really trusted Tom.
There are a lot of things Tom didn't tell you.
Tell Tom we're too tired to come over tonight.
Tell Tom Mary is waiting for him in the lobby.
Tell Tom I'm going to be gone for three weeks.
Someone has to tell Tom what happened to Mary.
Maybe you should tell Tom you don't need that.
Maybe you ought to do what Tom told you to do.
If you won't tell us, we'll find out from Tom.
I think that's what Tom was trying to tell me.
Tom examined the rock with a magnifying glass.
Tom will probably be the first person to come.
What you're doing is making the problem worse.
Do you know which room the meeting will be in?
I don't know the woman talking to our teacher.
Tom didn't yet know how to drive at that time.
You aren't driving without a license, are you?
These three beautiful girls are all my nieces.
I wonder why it took Tom that long to do that?
Tom can probably do that faster than Mary can.
My dog started barking when the doorbell rang.
I believe there is something suspicious afoot.
Tom dreamed that he would become an astronaut.
Tom stayed up very late studying for the exam.
The children were in their rooms sound asleep.
We don't have this kind of problem very often.
Tom requested that we stop what we were doing.
Tom often asks me to be generous and obedient.
If I don't go now my boss is going to fire me.
She's the girl whose performance won an Oscar.
She's only interested in fish and cockroaches.
What Tom said about Mary's family wasn't true.
Tom asked me the same questions Mary asked me.
Tom saw a car parked in front of Mary's house.
Tom is the funniest person that I've ever met.
Who else do you want to invite to our wedding?
Tom wanted to know what he was supposed to do.
Tom is in a good mood today, which is unusual.
Tom has been waiting for about thirty minutes.
Sorry, but I've got a lot to do at the moment.
A surprising number of interested people came.
The boy threw a paper airplane at the teacher.
Although I was exhausted, I continued to work.
I may be clumsy, but I'm not as clumsy as you.
As much as possible, I don't work on weekends.
I wondered whether or not we should buy a car.
Tom was aware of the gravity of the situation.
